Package com.stehno.ersatz.encdec

Class FunctionChain<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.stehno.ersatz.encdec.FunctionChain<T>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DecoderChain, EncoderChain
    public abstract class FunctionChain<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstraction for an object chain which will have method calls applied from "first" to "last" until a non-null result is returned.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor Description
      protected FunctionChain​(T firstItem)
      Creates a new chain with the provided (optional) first item.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void first​(T item)
      Adds the given item as the first in the chain (first to be checked).
      T getAt​(int index)
      Used to retrieve the item at the specified index.
      java.lang.Iterable<T> items()
      Provides an immutable iterator over the items (in order).
      void last​(T item)
      Adds the given item as the last in the chain (last to be checked).
      protected <F> F resolveWith​(java.util.function.Function<T,​F> resolver)
      Used by extension classes to perform the result resolution based on the closure.
      void second​(T item)
      Adds the given item as the second in the chain (second to be checked).
      int size()
      Retrieves the number of items in the chain.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • FunctionChain

        protected FunctionChain​(T firstItem)
        Creates a new chain with the provided (optional) first item. If the item is null, it will not be added.
        Parameters:
        firstItem - the optional first item (may be null)

    • Method Detail

      • first

        public final void first​(T item)
        Adds the given item as the first in the chain (first to be checked). If there is already and item in the chain, it will be pushed back down the resolution chain.
        Parameters:
        item - the first item

      • second

        public void second​(T item)
        Adds the given item as the second in the chain (second to be checked). If there are more than one items already in the chain, the items beyond the first will be pushed down the resolution chain; however, if there are no items in the chain, this will be the first.
        Parameters:
        item - the second item

      • last

        public void last​(T item)
        Adds the given item as the last in the chain (last to be checked).
        Parameters:
        item - the first item

      • resolveWith

        protected <F> F resolveWith​(java.util.function.Function<T,​F> resolver)
        Used by extension classes to perform the result resolution based on the closure. The closure will be passed each item and must return a value or null - null will cause the next item in the chain to be tested.
        Type Parameters:
        F - the contained type being resolved
        Parameters:
        resolver - the resolution closure
        Returns:
        the resolved result or null

      • getAt

        public T getAt​(int index)
        Used to retrieve the item at the specified index.
        Parameters:
        index - the index
        Returns:
        the item stored at the index (or null)

      • items

        public java.lang.Iterable<T> items()
        Provides an immutable iterator over the items (in order).
        Returns:
        iterator over the items

      • size

        public int size()
        Retrieves the number of items in the chain.
        Returns:
        the size of the chain
